description.narrative: Adaptación al cambio climático en áreas costeras del Río Uruguay (CAF-Fondo de Adaptación). Componente Regional Uruguay

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: 1.1)Number of instruments that were updated with focus on risk and climate change (Activity 1.1) 1.2)Number of members of territorial technical teams who participate in workshops-work meetings (broken down by gender and age) (Activity 1.2) 1.3)Number of officials of local, departmental and provincial governments who participate in workshops-work meetings (broken down by gender and age) (Activity 1.2) 1.4) Number of citizens (broken down by gender and age) who participate in workshops-work meetings (Activity 1.2) 2.1) Methodology document has been developed (Activity 2.1) 2.2) Methodology document has been developed (Activity 2.2) 2.3) Number of officials who participated and received training (broken down by gender and age); comment.narrative: 1.1) End of project: at least 2 Protected Areas plans, and at least 1 instrument for each locality/department involving housing, water, health, infrastructure, and public investment are updated 1.2) Medium term: 40 (50% from each country) End of project: 60 (50% from each country 1.3) Medium term: 40 (50% from each country) End of project: 100 (50% from each country, including at least 1 legislator from each block) 1.4) Medium term: 27 (at least 3 in each of the 9 cities, of which at least 1 is a woman) End of project: 60 (5 in each of the 12 cities in the extended area, with at least 2 women in each) End of project: 1 2.1) End of project: 1 2.2) End of project: 1 2.3) End of project: 50 - At least 1 representative of local authorities and 2 local technicians (1 man, 1 woman) from each of the 9 locations of direct intervention, and at least 20 representatives of departmental / provincial authorities. 3.1) End of project: 1 3.2) Mid-term: monitoring indicators of years 1 and 2 and mid-term evaluation.
